com.github.gwtd3.api.functions

Interface DatumFunction<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CountFunction, PropertyValueFunction

    public interface DatumFunction<T>
    A function taking an element and the index of the element in the selection, returning a value of type T.

    This function must be passed to mutator functions of Selection when you knows that nodes are not bound to any data.

    Author:
    Anthony Schiochet

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T apply(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element context, Value d, int index)
      Apply the function for the given Element at the specified index of the Selection mapped to the given Datum.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        T apply(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element context,
      Value d,
      int index)
        Apply the function for the given Element at the specified index of the Selection mapped to the given Datum.

        Note that if no datum is mapped to the element, Datum#isUndefined() will return true.

        Parameters:
        context - the current element, may be irrelevant or null in some context.
        d - the datum
        index - the index of the element in the selection
        Returns:
        a result to be applied
